I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I think -- I just want you guys to know, there was a lot of what ifs and possible misunderstandings, but nothing really bad has happened to me. But I can still lead even though I've never really had a traumatic experience. I keep trying to make them up and I'm not good at it because I've never had a traumatic experience. It's okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Walter.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: The last time I interrupted Tyrus, we got millions of YouTube views.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, we did.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: So I did that for you. No, Elizabeth Warren, I feel sorry for you. And you know why? Because you want me to so badly.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: It's helvo being a Democrat candidate. I mean, that's the essence of it, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: You're like some -- Mayor Pete is going to be saying he got a paper cut once, you know.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I really did get one before.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Really? Well, you should --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Get a move on.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm going to say about Elizabeth Warren. No wonder she lied about being pregnant. She learned her lesson when she lied about being an Indian to get into Harvard. So you know, because she was unfairly fired for the pregnancy. She you know, took on a native identity. I think Even Steven.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Even Steven. Excellent. All right, up next, guess who wants Hillary and run again? Not America.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. The search for two workers trapped under the wreckage of a collapsed hotel in New Orleans has been suspended. Portions of the Hard Rock Hotel, which was under construction came crashing down Saturday morning. At least one worker was killed, 18 others injured. Crews were using dogs and drones to locate the missing. The building is unstable. The search was halted for safety reasons, but it is expected to resume tomorrow. Meantime, wedding guests tackled a gunman after he allegedly opened fire at a New Hampshire church this morning. Two people were injured including a 75-year-old Bishop, Stanley Choate. He's in serious condition. About 40 people were at the wedding. The suspect was charged with first-degree assault. No word yet on a motive for that shooting. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did Trump just hatch a Hillary rematch? Up until this week, Hillary Clinton had been saying no to a 2020 run, then Trump gets on his Twitter and says, "Hillary should get in the race," as long as she explains why she deleted her e-mails, to which Hillary replied, "Don't tell tempt me. Do your job." God, I've missed those two. So deliciously nasty to each other. They're the Itchy and Scratchy of politics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anyway, later Hillary was asked about the exchange on something called PBS.

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, FORMER PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: There was no subpoena as he says in a tweet this morning. So maybe there does need to be a rematch. I mean, obviously I can beat him again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Obviously.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Obviously, she could beat him again. So that means she thinks she beat Trump in 2016.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So that she thinks she is the President now? Maybe she is, and the rest of us are high on edibles which would make her reelection ad look like this.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: The Hillary Clinton presidency, number forty five thousand bajillion. Medicare for owls. Puppies for all citizens.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: Arf, arf, arf, you know.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Winner of the Nobel Cheese Prize. Flying high on Pantsuit One. White House Easter Egg Hunt. The White House Dog. Snail Mail Only. Burn After Reading. Reelect Hillary 2020.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They are applauding out of confusion, Kat. That's a troubling ad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What do you think? You want her to run?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Listen. She is not running.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I do know why she is doing this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: For attention. She knows all she has to do is say she is running, we'll all talk about her and then she could turn around and be like, why is Fox News so obsessed with me? It's all -- and by the way, I'm not even hating on her for it. I'm saying game recognize game, right? I am obsessed with attention. I mean, look at my job. And you know I threw a funeral for myself when I was 30. If I ever get married, I intend on wearing one of those airplane neck pillows during the entire ceremony.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Just so people will be like what is she doing? And we'll write about it and you're not much better by the way with your little initials on the floor, okay, so I'm just letting you know you're not much -- you're not much better.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Not to mention, you just need one. You just need one G.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: For Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, he needs --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I only need one G.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, the painting of you shirtless riding a unicorn is a nice touch. So you recognize it, too, Greg. You like some attention yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So I'm not going to give it to her. I'm not going to entertain this. I'm just going to say you're sick. I get it. I'm sick, too. But I'm not going to feed your illness, Hillary. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Hillary running again. I didn't watch the last one, so why not? I'll check it out. The Democratic Party has got to just -- be just in knots over this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: All the momentum they have right now, all the huge events they're having. People, it's anarchy.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I've never seen people so excited.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Listen, after everything Elizabeth Warren has been through, you lay this on Hillary? She might actually get a real tragedy. Like the time she was running for President. Hillary showed up and took it all. Biden and her in a big showdown debate, where he turns to Bill and go, hey, remember, we were talking about 24 hour sex and bathhouses like -- it's tailor made for her to take it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Hillary reminds me of a TV character on a show that hangs around and passed her utility like the -- remember the annoying laugh lady on "Friends"?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Janice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you would know that.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: You know -- you know who Hillary reminds me of? Hillary reminds me of that night in the Monty Python sketch. So Henry gets his arm cut off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The Holy Grail.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: He says, come at me. And he gets -- finally he's a stump and he's like, don't tempt me.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: No, also this don't-tempt-me thing, that's Dirty Harry. Remember Dirty Harry?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: He was standing with a gun over a criminal. He wasn't lying on the ground with a gun on him. She is making threats that disguise the fact that she has lost two times.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: And I think that she is doing this -- I really have theorized about this, Kat. Is it to get attention or is she really running? And I'm going to ask Steve Bannon and he says, she is really running and I think she is, too.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's because she just wants attention from Steve Bannon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can get attention by running.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Yes. You get attention by running.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it for real?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I think it's for real. Although, actually your idea of Hillary as Dirty Harry is an actually a much better idea. Dirty Hillary, I would see that. You've got to ask yourself, punk, are you feeling lucky today? And then she fires and blows the studio lights out and falls on the floor in the street. I would -- I would go and -- I would go and see that. We don't need to -- we don't need to worry about this whole Hillary Clinton, I mean, for what it's worth, I've enjoyed the first Hillary Clinton term in office.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: It's been better than I expected.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I think I could -- I think I could take her reelection.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is a substitute teacher in Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: The one thing Joe Biden has done is he has actually streamline the model because under the Clinton model, you would have a Ukrainian oligarch give $4 million to the Clinton Foundation. And in return, Chelsea Clinton would give a speech on diarrhea in Africa and the Ukrainian oligarch would sleep through the speech. And now instead, Joe Biden has just made Hunter Biden a Ukrainian oligarch in his own right. And so the whole system is actually -- the whole system is, you said what you liked about Joe Biden is that he has actually streamlined the whole democratic corruption. And I think he has left Hillary looking like last year's mob. It's not just the gay bathhouse. There's more to Joe Biden than the gay bathhouse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. There really is more. And we're going to save it for the next block. Up next, while the NBA bends to China, "South Park" gives them the finger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why does the NBA appease the Communist Chinese? It started when Houston Rockets General Manager Daryl Morey tweeted support for pro- democracy activists in Hong Kong. Then he deleted it, but not before pissing off the commies. Suddenly, Chinese businesses started suspending deals with the Rockets which causes the team to apologize and the NBA Commissioner to say this.

utterances.speaker: ADAM SILVER, NBA COMMISSIONER
utterances.utterance: I'm sympathetic to our interest here and to our partners who are upset, and I don't think it's inconsistent on one hand to be sympathetic to them, and at the same time stand by our principles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What principles? Critics say the NBA is putting money before American values. The same NBA, mind you, who lectured Americans on their values. AOC and Ted Cruz have signed a letter asking the NBA Chair to suspend activities in China. Yes, the two most polar opposite lawmakers in D.C. agree that the NBA sucks. Well done, NBA. Unity. Now compare that to "South Park". Last week's episode mocks American companies bowing to Chinese sensors, which got them banned in China. And after the NBA's cowardice, "South Park" released their own apology, saying quote, "Like the NBA, we welcome the Chinese censors into our homes and into our hearts. We, too love money more than freedom and democracy. Xi doesn't look just like Winnie the Pooh at all. Long live the great Communist Party of China. We good now, China?" So in sum, "South Park" was this, and the NBA was this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I didn't even know that stock photography existed. Tyrus, what irritates you most about this story?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I think the biggest thing that irritates me is the coverage of this because I listened to Silver's speech and if you have to listen to all of it, he was apologetic that their deals weren't going to work out, but he would not condemn what the man said. And that's important because they lost money. They're going to lose over a billion dollars in this deal. China has taken it to the -- I'm concerned about the players still being over there because they've cancelled all media. They've made it to where it's punishable for fans to go see the NBA players. So I would like the NBA players to get their behinds home because Americans over in a communist country who is upset with us is not a good idea. But the fact that we're not listening to the whole -- the whole story and that's what -- and that bothers me a little bit. A lot of companies would have fired that man, the ones who we see in this country all the time where somebody says something and they lose their job and their career over it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Trying to do --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Where it's kind of hypocritical right now for the United States to talk trash about anybody bowing when we literally do it on somebody tweet it. I find it hilarious to where if Silver was doing what we've been doing over here, as a country, he would have came out, that guy from the Rockets would have been fired and he said he doesn't represent the NBA. He doesn't do this and that. This man is gone. What he did say is, it is unfortunate this happened, but we support him and his right for free speech, which cost them the deal in China. So I think before we start talking trash and then of course "South Park." I love those, guys. Man, they've been doing it for so long. They do not care and they baited them in because I can imagine the interpreter in China reading it like, yes, they got it and they watched episode one.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They just don't care. You know like and the fact that you think they're going to care is hilarious. Nobody is safe. Any one of us can end up on that cartoon. I think it's an honor when they make fun of you. But that is true comedy. And that's a beautiful thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Walter?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Well, you can applaud for Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They weren't sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They were like, I don't know if I agree, but I'll applaud.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, turned this into a thoughtful show like "The View."

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Well, here's what I think.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Wait until I get to my phone.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Here's what I think about the Houston Rockets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: I think first of all about "South Park" that they don't have to complain about the tradeoff between money and free speech because they've got both.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. That's true.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: And second of all, I think that Trump isn't weighing in on this because he put himself in a bad position criticizing the NFL. If you want to talk about free speech, you've got to talk about it across the board and you know, since professional sports seems to be the place where we're playing out all our controversies these days, you know, he should stand back and let it rip.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true. I can't wait until lacrosse becomes a controversy. Oh my god, Mark.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes, no, no. I'm with you there. I can't wait for -- I was hoping this would precipitate a World War.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Personally. Because I've never -- I can't -- when people say well, what do you have to say about the basketball con -- what do you mean the basketball con? And what was it, Tyrus, you said they like fired -- whether they were going to fire the guy from the Rockets?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Wouldn't it be great if like a basketball team called the Rockets cause more of a war than actual rockets. So I'm with you, I'm waiting for the lacrosse -- and actually my favorite would be ice dancing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I would like -- I would like -- I like ice dancing. I like curling. I would love to have a World War provoked -- I would like -- where are the curlers on this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Don't they want to imprison the people of Hong Kong for another 50 years, too? Why is nobody from ice dancing speaking out?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Have you seen women's soccer lately? I mean --

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes, no, no. Definitely, I'm for -- this is the best reason to have a World War that's come along in years.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, I see -- I see trouble brewing in ping pong. I don't know what it is, but it is happening.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It's not trouble. Honestly, I know some of you may disagree with me. But I could not be more thrilled about the NBA sucking up to China.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, because now I have a principled and patriotic reason to not watch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Before I had to just be like, listen, I'm only on my 23rd run through the fourth season of "ALF" and I want to make sure I'm not missing any nuances in the humor.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You never know. But now I can be like, we don't watch that game in this house because we are Americans and we are patriotic.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And then everyone will apologize to me. I don't have to watch basketball and I get to look like a patriot instead of a weirdo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The only --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I win. They did it for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think you're going to have to do more than that.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: What? To make me not look like a weirdo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Thank you for completing my thought. The point I think that we have to always remember, it's about the phony virtue signaling of the NBA who lectures us on morality about you know, transgender bathrooms, and then when they have to put the money where their mouth is. They shut up.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Boycott.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, boycott.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: What happens then?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boycott. All right, up next. We're kidding. We don't boycott anything here. Are wedding costs driving men to commit crimes? I hope so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He wanted a wife not, 25 to life. Police say a Texas man, Heath Bumpus -- best name ever -- has confessed to robbing a bank the day before his wedding because he needed money for the ring and the venue. Injustice. After his daring hold up, police posted pictures from the bank surveillance camera on Facebook. He didn't even attempt to disguise himself. That's love. That's love. So guess who recognized him? His fiancee who said turn yourself in. What a snitch. So he did. The wedding didn't happen on account of it. Heath Bumpus being in jail. He has been charged with robbery, though it's still not as bad a crime as this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It never gets old.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It never gets old.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And they pop every time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mark, if you go to rob a bank, you take a risk like that, spend it on something awesome like a gold plated submarine.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. By the way, that song would have been a much bigger hit if I'd been called Heath Bumptious. That is like the greatest name ever. I feel very sorry for this guy because he forgot to disguise himself. In fact, he actually -- I wonder because you're meant to -- aren't you meant to wear a ski mask when you hold up a bank?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think so.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think you want it over your head. And he obviously -- he must have maybe he had it with his wedding gear and he was like going to turn up -- The guy didn't actually make it to the wedding. She wanted a $3,200.00 ring.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Terrible.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: The poor guy is unemployed.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Greg, I figured it out. He didn't really want to get married.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: And now, it hasn't happened. He's on $300,000.00 bail for stealing a thousand bucks. So the sheriff has done him a favor. He's never going to be married to the gal who wanted a $3,200.00 ring. He paid for the event facility. $2,600.00 he paid a $20.00 bills, which I think --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They even had like green paint on him.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes. But I wanted to see him walking down the aisle with the ski mask on because I think that would have been beautiful, very touching.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, most romantic gesture ever.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, I've never really understood the whole big wedding thing. I don't see the need for it. Most people are like, Kat, that's because you don't have a fiancee, but that's true. But it's because I just have never had the urge to spend tens of thousands of dollars like getting everyone from my cousin back home to my great aunt's new boyfriend drunk and feeding them beef tenderloin. Like I don't understand. I don't want to push redskin potatoes and unrealistic expectations of love on people. It's horrible for single people. Anyone ever done like a stupid thing at a wedding?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No. I was going to say just my friend. You know it happens, because it's like going into a haunted house of emotional minefields, if you're single to go to a wedding and if you're married, it's bad, too, because you compare your wedding to, you know, to their wedding and you know that you're like, Bob, you know, oh, they have liquor here. We didn't have liquor at our wedding. And then you know, Linda turns to some stranger and says the same thing. It's garbage for everyone. Just get married in your apartment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know, fellas, I've just got to say, it's okay to say no. I mean, it's been a tough -- we had a dude who drowned himself, if you read that story, he drowned during the proposal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I did see that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, he went -- he went underwater with a snorkel, drowned himself. This guy looks at the camera like come get me. He robbed the bank 500 feet from the sheriff's office. Fellas, it's okay to say no. We've got to learn to say no or hell no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I mean, it's just -- this is where we're at in the world. We would rather go to jail or die. Listen, I bet -- I understand. I'd been at that one time when I did something stupid. I said yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Like, I get it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Last word, Walter?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Well, I can't really say anything because, you know, I wish that I'd robbed the bank before my second wedding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Your second wedding.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.utterance: Yes, my third is working out, but for my fourth, I'm definitely going to shoplift, you know.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: If you're still looking for a fiancee, Heath Bumptious is available.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you know where he is at all times.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I was going to say, I do like that he couldn't cheat on me with a woman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, a beautiful ending to a strange, strange wonderful segment. All right, four shows remain for "The Gutfeld Monologues Live" fall tour. We're in Jacksonville November 16th, Durham the 17th, Cleveland December 7th. Knoxville, December 8th. Tickets still available. Go to ggutfeld. com for information.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're out of time. Thanks to Walter Kirn, Mark Steyn, Kat, Tyrus, our studio audience. I'm Greg Gutfeld, I love you, America.
